definition: darlings/fans/followers/short form of 親愛的們|亲爱的们
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring
plural marker for pronouns, and nouns referring to individuals

sentences.english: Thank you for all of your wonderful creations.
sentences.chinese: 亲们的创作都非常漂亮，真的非常感谢。

sentences.english: Recent restaurant will add clothes and jewelry, are a perfect match to the pro.
sentences.chinese: 近期本店还会新增衣服首饰，给亲们完美的搭配。

sentences.english: This is the part when fans could have a close encounter with their idol.
sentences.chinese: 这个环节亲们可以近距离的看到他。

sentences.english: Today, I'd like to introduce you to euramerican style of clothing.
sentences.chinese: 今天向亲们介绍欧美风的服装。

sentences.english: Prefer our collection of what can be hoped that pro shopping.
sentences.chinese: 喜欢本店可以收藏一下，希望亲们购物愉快。

sentences.english: He thanked his fans again for their support.
sentences.chinese: 他再次感谢亲们的支援。

definition: sentence-final particle that conveys informality, warmth, friendliness or intimacy/may also indicate that one is stating a fact that the other person is not aware of
oh (interjection indicating that one has just learned sth)
oh (interjection indicating doubt or surprise)
to chant
(Internet slang) friend (pun on 朋友[peng2 you3])
editor or creator of online content (diminutive term, often used to refer to oneself: I, me, this writer)
everybody/all (guests, colleagues etc)/all of you
Oh! (exclamation of dismay etc)/see 呦呦[you1 you1]
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
(onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat
(slang) come on, you can't deny it!/don't you think so?!/(melodramatic form of 有沒有|有没有)

cutie/sweetie/(Tw) camisole (women's garment)
Have a nice weekend!

you (plural)
(sentence-final particle expressing exhortation)/(syllable filler in a song)

(phonetic)/command to a horse/clatter (of horses' hoofs)
